constituent: marry into, woman, house, sow, pig
heisigStory: The kanji in this frame demonstrates the traditional Japanese approach to marriage: it is the woman who leaves her family for another household, thus marrying into a man's family.
koohiiStory1: Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the woman feels more like she´s married into the house than into a relationship.
koohiiStory2: Traditionally, it was the women who would marry into the households of their husband´s families.
myStory: cưới về. cô dâu. cô gái về nhà.
readingExamples: 嫁ぐ (とつ.ぐ), 嫁 (よめ)
